descriptions: Teams net points while player is on the court.
Teams net points while player is on the court.

article.description: Tracy McGrady scored 25 points despite sitting out the fourth quarter as the Magic crushed the Grizzlies for the second time this season and ninth game in a row, 119-103.
article.headline: Orlando coasts after opening 41-17 lead in first
article.linkText: Undermanned, overmatched Grizzlies fall to Magic
article.story:
MEMPHIS, Tenn. (AP) -- As the Memphis Grizzlies struggled to stay competitive, the Orlando Magic seized the opportunity to rest their starters and give their reserves valuable playing time.
McGrady

Tracy McGrady had 25 points, 10 rebounds and seven assists as the Magic beat the injury-depleted Grizzlies 119-103 Saturday night. One Orlando starter played at least 30 minutes, and reserves Troy Hudson, Don Reid and Monty Williams played more than 20 for the Magic. "It was a breather," Orlando coach Doc Rivers said. "It got tight there for one moment, but we still went to the bench anyway, and I think it gave the bench a vote of confidence." McGrady shot 9-for-14 from the field and converted all six of his free throws in 26 minutes as Orlando beat Memphis for the second time this season and dealt the Grizzlies their third straight loss. Hudson added 18 points and seven assists for the Magic. Mike Miller scored 16 points and Pat Garrity 15. Memphis rookie Shane Battier missed his first game of the season with a strained left groin. The Grizzlies were also without Michael Dickerson and Lorenzen Wright. "I was looking at their injury report before the game," McGrady said, "and I was like, 'Man, who do they have left to play?' " Pau Gasol led the Grizzlies with 26 points and 17 rebounds. Will Solomon scored a career-high 23 points, and Antonis Fotsis finished with a career-best 21 points. "We worked hard toward the end of the game," Gasol said. "I think the young players did a good job. We just tried to get into the game." Orlando shot 58 percent in the first quarter and built a 41-17 lead. The Magic's 41 points were the most allowed by the Grizzlies in any quarter this season. Orlando extended its lead to 33 points in the second period and held a 69-44 advantage at the break. "The first quarter, they really hurt us, and that was the ball game," Memphis coach Sidney Lowe said. Miller scored 14 in the first half, while McGrady added 13 first-half points. "When (Miller) gets off to a good start, as a team we do well," Rivers said. "(McGrady) is going to get his touches, that's guaranteed, and play well most of the time. When you get the other guys coming off the bench and playing well, that is really good." The Grizzlies closed within 13 points twice in the second half, but the Magic deflected the comeback attempt and led 96-79 after three quarters.

Game notes
Battier's injury snapped his string of 38 consecutive starts. He was the only Memphis player to start every game. ... The Magic beat Memphis 113-71 in the teams' first meeting on Dec. 13. ... Orlando has won 11 of 12 games in the series. ... Garrity was the only Orlando starter to play 30 minutes. Hudson came off the bench to play 29 minutes...The Magic are now 14-8 when they score at least 100 points. ... Orlando shot 52 percent from the field. The Magic are 7-0 when shooting better than 50 percent.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
